page.title: 03Monmouth,a Market Town
page.content: Whilst many towns have lost their {markets,}Monmouth still is a centre for the sale of{farm animals.}The {auctioneers}Rennie,Taylor,Miles and Escott and Coles,Knapp and Kennedy are joint tenants. A market is held every Monday and on the second and last Friday of each month. In addition there are five seasonal{sheep {sales}held in the Autumn. An average Monday market would consist of 40 fat cattle, between 400 and 900 sheep and between 12-20 calves. The Friday sales are for{store cattle and on average there would be 200 cattle.The seasonal sheep sales would have 3000 ewes 1500 lambing,and 70 rams. Recently{trade}decreased due to competition from larger markets. Large wholesalers buy in large quantities - thus an adverse effect.
